__data__.text: BLUEBOOK- THE -

HOW TO 
USE THE   
BLUEBOOK
WHAT DOES  
YOUR COMPANY DO?
If someone asks you this 
question at a conference, a 
dinner party or elsewhere, 
there are several ways to 
answer. The Bluebook  
is designed to inspire and 
help you to talk about 
Dassault Systèmes in 
everyday personal and 
professional situations. 
This handbook is divided into two main 
parts: 
 • Engage in conversation: the first part 
gives you the essentials to talk about (or 
“pitch”) Dassault Systèmes in just a few 
minutes.
• Feed the discussion:  the second part 
is a Q&A intended to be a discussion 
between you and your family, friends or 
business contacts. It dives deeper into 
all kinds of topics related to Dassault 
Systèmes to give you detailed answers. 
The Bluebook empowers you to 
talk about Dassault Systèmes, while 
allowing plenty of room for your own 
personal touch and flair. Our story is 
the story of Dassault Systèmes people: 
make it yours!
Important note:
The Bluebook was originally published 
in 2019 and was updated in October 
2023 with facts & figures from the 
2022 Universal Registration Document 
and select major developments, such 
as the acquisition of Medidata and the 
2020 introduction of the company’s 
fifth legacy stage. A complete update is 
forthcoming for 2024. 3THE BLUEBOOK | 2019 - V2 (2023)

5THE BLUEBOOK | 2019 - V2 (2023)

Dassault Systèmes is the story of a company that has gone from startup to global 
leader in innovation, spanning all countries and all industries! We have set ourselves 
and achieved some incredible challenges regarded by everyone else in the market 
to be impossible, among them 3D Design, the Digital Mock-UP (DMU), Product 
Lifecycle Management (PLM), and today 3DEXPERIENCE .
Marcel Dassault, 1980, using the first version 
of CATIACurrent Dassault Systèmes Chairman and 
Chief Executive Office Bernard Charlès speaking 
with former Chairman, Charles Edelstenne.
DASSAULT SYSTÈMES
IS AN AMAZING  
SUCCESS  STORY!
We provide solutions for over 300,000 companies  
in 12 industries, worldwide. 
- CONFIDENTIAL -

The first challenge to get us underway 
came along in 1981. At the time, 
engineers still designed aircraft on paper 
drawing boards – 2D computer-aided 
design was only in the embryonic stage. 
Marcel Dassault (the founder of the 
industrial firm that bears his name) and 
Charles Edelstenne (former Chairman of 
the Board of Directors) embarked on the 
dual challenge of creating their own 3D 
software to design aircraft and setting up 
a separate company to sell the software 
to other industries. Dassault Systèmes 
was born.
In 1981, Dassault Systèmes consisted of 
an R&D lab with about 20 people working for one sector of industry – aerospace – 
with just one brand, CATIA.
Today, our workforce has grown to 
22,500 people and we market a portfolio 
of 13 brands: 3DEXCITE, 3DVIA, BIOVIA, 
CATIA, CENTRIC PLM, DELMIA, ENOVIA, 
EXALEAD, GEOVIA, NETVIBES, OUTSCALE, 
SIMULIA and SOLIDWORKS.
We serve 
12
INDUSTRIESAerospace  
& Defense
Consumer Packaged 
Goods - RetailHigh  
Tech
Transportation
& MobilityMarine  
& OffshoreLife Sciences

& Lifestyle

The world’s first-ever 3D protein structure model , 
aimed at furthering understanding into cell-level 
medical treatments. This pioneering work was 
awarded the Nobel Prize for Chemistry in 2013 and 
all treatments are now developed this way.
The Boeing 777  – the world’s first jetliner to be 100% 
digitally designed. Since then, all other aircraft are 
designed using digital technology.For the past 40 years, working 
closely with customers and end-users, 
Dassault Systèmes has spearheaded 
many technology breakthroughs that 
have had a profound impact on society  
and on people’s lives.DASSAULT SYSTÈMES
IS AT THE  
FOREFRONT  
OF INNOVATION
Digital Mock-Up  
of the Boeing 777 -  
Board from the Museum 
of Flight, Seattle.

Renaulution  – using our virtual twins to  
help Renault make a strategic shift from 
a product company to a technology, 
services and energy company. 
The Living Heart  – the first-ever 3D 
model of a beating human heart, 
ushering in personalized treatments for 
heart disease and shaping the future of 
all medical research.

About 40% of new clinical 
trials are supported by our 
solutions.
6 of the top 10 shoe 
companies in the world work 
with us.
Our solutions have enabled 
the production of 60% of 
the world's wind turbines.
Thinking of remodeling your 
kitchen? HomeByMe is an 
interactive room planning 
experience that combines 
3D digital space planning, 
automation and intelligence 
to help you both envision 
and shop for items to 
transform your house. 
All electric vehicle 
manufacturers are 
innovating with our 
design and manufacturing 
solutions.All planes in the world 
are designed with our 
software solutions, and 
including aircraft that relies 
on alternative energy. In 
fact, the first solar-powered 
plane to fly – Solar Impulse 
– was designed with the 
3DEXPERIENCE  platform.
Do you admire the 
remarkable architecture of 
Louis Vuitton Foundation 
in Paris? It would have 
been impossible to design 
the building without 
Dassault Systèmes, just like 
so many buildings across the 
world designed by Kengo 
Kuma & Associates, Frank 
Gehry and other major 
architects.DASSAULT SYSTÈMES’
IMPACT IS ALL AROUND 
FROM THE ATOM  
TO THE CITY
Almost everything around us is enabled  
in some way by Dassault Systèmes.

DASSAULT  SYSTÈMES
IS A 
SCIENCE-
BASED  
COMPANY
We’re not in the video game 
business! The virtual worlds  
we develop are the “twin”  
of the real world. It’s not just 
a matter of realistic rendering: 
the virtual worlds created with 
our software solutions are 
100% realistic in the sense that 
they’re based on mathematical 
and physical laws. Scientific 
knowledge lies at the heart  
of everything we do. 12
THE BLUEBOOK | 2019 - V2 (2023)

SCIENCE IS OUR INSPIRATION
To us, science isn’t only about knowing 
more; it’s about driving social progress, 
exploring the unknown and making the 
impossible possible. We draw on various 
branches of science – mathematics, 
biology, chemistry, physics, geology – 
to break down silos of knowledge and 
find the most innovative, sustainable 
solutions for the future. For over 
40  years, we’ve led the global field in 
multidisciplinary, multi-scale solutions.SCIENCE IS OUR MINDSET
Our approach is based on critical 
thinking and we never assume that 
we’ve explored everything there is to 
know. 
SCIENCE IS A CRITICAL 
DIFFERENTIATING FACTOR
We are the only company capable of 
providing a complete virtual twin of the 
world, that is to say a model-based and 
data-driven representation. Our digital 
models combine two dimensions: the 
virtual, in the form of an abstract model 
of a given object (based on the scientific 
and mathematical laws of nature); and 
the real, derived from all data associated 
with the object (from all possible sources, 
the Internet of Things, the cloud, the 
enterprise, etc.). 
The value of our platform lies in blending 
creative thinking (model-based) with 
existing knowledge (data-driven).
SCIENTISTS ARE  
OUR CUSTOMERS
We work closely with researchers like 
Martin Karplus, winner of the 2013 
Nobel Prize in Chemistry, who believes 
that the unlimited experimental 
capabilities of virtual models can help 
steer research more effectively, saving 
time and achieving considerably greater 
accuracy.13

We are changing the rules of the game for a positive impact  
on society.DASSAULT SYSTÈMES
IS PURPOSE-
DRIVEN
Since its inception, and at every stage 
in its history (3D Design, 3D DMU, 3D 
PLM, the 3DEXPERIENCE  platform and 
Virtual Twin Experience of Humans), 
Dassault Systèmes has been committed 
to contributing positively to society. 
Our purpose, established in 2012, 
reflects this commitment. 
It is shared with our customers, our 
partners and – without a shadow of a 
doubt – Dassault Systèmes people and 
partners.
This force for good, our purpose, is 
changing the rules of the game and is 
one of the reasons why so many market-
leading organizations are playing the game with us. Being a purpose-driven 
company also translates into a high 
level of market confidence and trust , 
because we know where we’re going.   
Our purpose is driven by the passion 
demonstrated by everyone in our 
company . It gives meaning to our 
daily work, it drives a shared approach 
to our job, and it brings energy to the 
company.
With this purpose, we’re setting even 
higher standards across the market 
for the benefit of everyone. The 
companies that embrace it will have 
the competitive edge they need to 
succeed in the coming decades.We provide business and people with 3DEXPERIENCE  universes 
to imagine sustainable innovations capable of harmonizing 
product, nature and life.14

Achieving a more sustainable future is only possible by leveraging the virtual world. 
Building on the past and pointing to the future, the virtual twin is a real scientific and 
industrial asset as well an asset for the wider community. It enables us to invent new 
usages, the products underpinning them and the production tooling involved, all in 
virtual universe. Generally speaking, in life there are no rehearsals. But in the virtual 
world, we can simulate and evaluate impacts before making the product itself. 
Bernard Charlès
RANKED IN THE 
TOP 10 COMPANIES

CIRCULAR ECONOMY**Corporate Knights

1981
3D DESIGN  
3D Design marked 
the dawn of three-
dimensional design of 
the surface  of things.
 Transformation:  high-
performance innovation 
achieved ‘right first 
time’ .  
 Our emblematic 
customer:  Dassault 
Aviation1989
3D DIGITAL MOCKUP
3D Digital Mock-Up 
(DMU) paved the way 
for three-dimensional 
design of entire complex 
systems , outside and 
inside.
 Transformation:  
collaborative  innovation  
 Our emblematic 
customer:  Boeing1999
3D PRODUCT LIFECYCLE 
MANAGEMENT 
3D Product Lifecycle 
Management (PLM) 
introduced the representation 
of time . This is what we call 
the “lifecycle” or the end-to-
end product management 
entirely in 3D – from design 
through to recycling and 
including production and 
distribution.
 Transformation:  innovation at 
every stage in the value chain  
 Our emblematic customer:  
ToyotaDASSAULT SYSTÈMES

We are shaping 21st century industry!
Industry would not be what it is today without Dassault Systèmes’ contribution. We 
have been the catalyst and enabler of the greatest industrial transformations.  Every 
decade, we have helped manufacturers to disrupt how products are designed and 
made, and to rethink their whole development and production methods. To do so, we 
use the virtual world to transform how we represent the real world.
2020
VIRTUAL TWIN EXPERIENCE OF 
HUMANS
Imagine being able to model, test and 
cure a human body as well as we do with 
a plane or a car – moving from things 
to life. We call this the “virtual twin 
experience of humans” .
 Transformation:  innovation by and for 
the consumer-patient  
 Our emblematic customer:  Medidata 
joining Dassault Systèmes2012
3DEXPERIENCE  
3DEXPERIENCE  goes beyond the 
product itself, as it aims to represent 
perception and emotion . This is what we 
call “experience” – how we perceive and 
use goods and services.
 Transformation:  innovation by and for 
the consumer-citizen  
 Our emblematic customer:  the city of 
Singapore17

DASSAULT  SYSTÈMES
IS A LEADER IN  
INNOVATION 
PLATFORMS
What Amazon has done for 
consumer goods, we want to 
do for Industry.
Today, consumers value the way 
they use a product and the services 
associated with it more than the 
product itself. This is what’s referred 
to as the experience economy.  
At Dassault Systèmes, we are 
innovation-driven. In 2012 we 
embraced transformation by shifting 
from a software company to an 
experience company. What does that 
mean? We provide our customers not 
just with products but with services 
and content. This is why we designed 
our 3DEXPERIENCE  platform with a 
twofold objective in mind.Boeing needed to have a 
comprehensive overview of its 
business and manage end-to-end 
relationships across its ecosystem. 
It also wanted to control business 
flows between its own facilities and 
divisions as well as with and among 
its partners.
Why did they select Dassault 
Systèmes? Because we focus on the 
value of business relationships – we 
call it the value network – and this is 
the linchpin of our 3DEXPERIENCE  
platform.18

The 3DEXPERIENCE  platform as 
a system of operations
As a system of operations, the 
3DEXPERIENCE  platform enables 
businesses to reach operational 
excellence. It allows everyone involved in 
an innovation project – from the research 
lab to the factory to the consumer – to 
interact and work together. As a result, it 
empowers innovators to design and test 
consumer experiences, from the idea 
to market delivery and usage, before 
actually producing them.The 3DEXPERIENCE  platform as 
a business model
As a business model, the 3DEXPERIENCE 
platform allows businesses to become 
“platform companies” that transform 
the relationships and roles across their 
business network, mostly by removing 
intermediaries between sellers and 
buyers, purchasers and subcontractors, 
service providers and end-customers. 
This is why our platform also acts as 
a marketplace, or trading platform, 
that connects customers willing to buy 
services (3D printing, design etc.) and 
service providers.
19

DASSAULT  SYSTÈMES
IS THE 
GUTENBERG 
OF THE 21ST 
CENTURY
Something big is happening. 
The world is experiencing a 
global transformation in the 
ways we invent, learn, produce 
and trade. It is as great a 
change as the Renaissance 
that occurred in Europe from 
the 14th to the 16th century. 
Just like printed books made 
scientific, artistic, political, 
economic and spiritual change 
possible, virtual worlds make 
it possible to share, improve 
and extend knowledge and 
know-how. The new book is the 
virtual experience, and Dassault 
Systèmes is the catalyst and 
enabler of the 21st century 
Industry Renaissance.We believe that the future is in people 
not machines. Tomorrow’ s leaders will 
be those who empower the workforce 
of the future with the best-developed 
knowledge and know-how assets. 
Not those with the most automated 
production systems. This is possible 
thanks to virtual experience platforms. 
They have transformed retail (think 
of Amazon), transportation (think of 
Uber) and tourism (think of Airbnb). 
Industry is next.
Johannes Gutenberg (1400-1468)  
invented the printing press in Europe20

Look around you. It’s not reindustrialization. It’s a true rebirth. We see new categories 
of innovators creating new categories of solutions for new categories of consumers.
• Tesla and ASKA are competing with BMW and Boeing.
• With no physical industrial assets, Amazon has become a full-fledged industry player.
• Clinical trials are increasingly decentralized, allowing a more diverse set of patients 
to participate.
• In fablabs, we can create and print smart connected objects in just a few hours.
With Dassault Systèmes’ 3DEXPERIENCE  platform,

process around 
its clients’ custom 
orders, from 
requests through 
to machining and 
delivery.INTERSTELLAR LAB 
develops 
environmentally 
controlled, closed-
loop modules 
designed for self-
sustainable life on 
Earth and beyond.KENGO KUMA 
absorbs tons of CO2 
with fabric.BOEING 
prepares to 
become the 
best industrial 
company of the 
21st century.SAINT -LOUIS 
UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL  
understands how 
respiratory-borne 
pathogens spread 
to help prevent 
the transmission 
of viruses among 
immunocompromised 
patients.
NOWY STYL 
connects its 
supply chain and 
standardizes 
processes to help 
reshape today’s 
flexible office 
environment.21

We live in an age where businesses 
need to look beyond the aesthetics of a 
product or the practicalities of a service, 
where consumer engagement and 
loyalty count far more than features 
and benefits alone, where consumers 
expect to interact with or even influence 
suppliers – not just be sold to. Products 
are no longer enough for today’s 
consumers who value experience above 
everything else. The Age of Experience 
has arrived.The key to making consumer experience 
the true focus of innovation is to capture 
insights and expertise from across a 
business’s entire ecosystem. Shaping the 
right consumer experience requires not 
only the involvement of, but collaboration 
among, all the roles within a company – 
from engineering to marketing to sales. 
Only by connecting all the dots between 
people, ideas and data can a business 
drive consumer loyalty, engagement and 
value. This is what our 3DEXPERIENCE  
platform offers.We offer a new approach to innovation and doing business in 
the experience economy.Virtual kitchen by HomeByMe.
3DEXPERIENCE  
IS CHANGING 
THE WORLD
22

Since our customers’ businesses, in all 
Industries, are about creating experiences 
for their own clients, our 3DEXPERIENCE  
platform enables them to think about the 
end-customer experience at any stage of 
product or service creation.
We provide unprecedented advantages to 
our clients:
 They can experience their product 
themselves – virtually (while it can still be 
changed quickly and cost-effectively) and 
pervasively (throughout their organization, 
whether contributors sit in marketing or 
engineering).
 They can let their consumers experience 
the virtual products , services and core 
values of their brands before bringing 
them to market.
Dassault Systèmes is not a software 
company, not a PLM (Product Lifecycle 
Management) company, not a DMU 
(Digital Mock-Up) company and not a 3D 
Design company. These positions do not 
differentiate us enough, because they 
define a product, a business process, or a 
way of serving clients that other companies 
can claim to do as well. We are a company 
that provides virtual worlds for real life: 
scientific-based environments that enable 
innovative minds limitless opportunity to 
test and develop sustainable experiences 
to benefit the world and the people who 
live in it.23

We are a global leader in sustainable innovation.
Our business is innovation.  We provide software solutions that allow customers to 
create innovative new products and services using virtual experiences. Our aim is to 
achieve a new development model to address the major challenges facing the world 
today.1
We empower governments to make the right 
decisions by offering them virtual simulations 
to improve the experiences of citizens.
Energy transition is key to us: we help 
governments and businesses improve nuclear 
safety and develop sustainable energies.
We are working with the pharmaceutical 
industry to simulate the effect of drugs on 
different genomes and tumor propagation in 
order to develop precision medicine.
We are acting as a global driving force for 
the sustainable transformation of industry to 
make a positive impact on society.
Education needs to adopt a more multi-
disciplinary approach to inspire young people 
to take up careers in science and technology.CITIES FOR PEOPLE
Two-thirds of humanity will live in cities by 2050
ENERGY & RESOURCES FOR THE LONG TERM
During the past year, we have used more resources 
from nature than it can renew in one year.
FOOD AND PERSONALIZED HEALTHCARE
3D simulation is defining the future of medicine
SUSTAINABLE SUPLLY AND PRODUCTION
Shaping the industry of the future 
INSPIRATIONAL EDUCATION AND RESEARCH
Empowering the workforce of the futureWHAT DOES 
DASSAULT SYSTÈMES DO?

We help customers to face their most ambitious challenges; 
for example:
 How to make cities great places to live and work?
 How to care for the entire planet and for each individual?
 How to conduct clinical trials to roll out a vaccine in less than a year?
 How to design the entire product lifecycle?
 How to make sustainable purchasing choices?
 How to prepare the workforce of the future for the jobs of the 
   future?
 How to develop new paradigms of scientific observation and reasoning?

Our purpose is to provide business and people with 3D EXPERIENCE  universes where 
they can imagine sustainable innovations capable of harmonizing product, nature, 
and life.
“Harmonizing product, nature and life”  is how we define sustainable innovation. It is 
based on the premise that, in the 21st century, with a global population of 8 billion, we 
cannot produce and consume in the same way that we did in the 20th century, when 
the population was just 2.5 billion (1950).
A product cannot be sustainable if its impact on the environment and on society has 
not been thought through. Conversely, product design can be improved by observing 
nature and other living creatures.WHAT IS 
DASSAULT SYSTÈMES’  
PURPOSE?2
3
Our purpose has taken shape with 3D EXPERIENCE , which is all about achieving a more 
sustainable future by empowering our customers to manage their value network.
We help our customers take into account the realities of today’s experience economy, 
in which consumers are no longer concerned just about the features of a product but 
about how it is used and the benefits it brings. We want to provide experiences to our 
customers in which they can connect all the dots between people, ideas and data to 
define the right value for their products, design and engineer them, and be able to 
share that vision with their consumers.
Concretely, our 3DEXPERIENCE  platform enables companies to freely test their ideas, 
their products and the experiences they provide before actually producing them . This 
means that they can invent new usages and the products supporting them. This is 
what we call sustainable innovation.HOW DOES DASSAULT SYSTÈMES 
FULFILL THIS PURPOSE?29

3DEXPERIENCE  focuses on the end-user’s experience. PLM only focuses on the 
product, its features and how it’s produced.
We have not pulled out of PLM; it remains part of our solutions. But 3DEXPERIENCE  is 
broader and lies at the heart of our distinctive positioning in the experience economy. 
It allows us to play in the new social industry world that our customers are facing and 
that requires them to evolve from “product attributes” to experiences.
Far from it! The experience economy changes how companies think, produce and 
deliver their products, as well as the value delivered to consumers. Our 3D EXPERIENCE 
platform is a driving force of this transformation.
Experience is the new business focus and a growing priority for firms everywhere, 
whatever their size, area of business or strategic objectives. We live in an age where 
 businesses need to look beyond the aesthetics of a product or the practicalities  
    of a service;
 consumer engagement counts far more than features and benefits alone;
 consumers expect to interact with or even influence suppliers – not just be sold to.
 companies must prioritize sustainable best practices in their daily operations.
A perfect example of this concept is the iPhone, which has revolutionized the way 
we use the telephone. From an object originally intended to make and receive calls, 
the telephone has evolved to become a product that lets users enjoy an entirely 
personalized experience, with a powerful emotional dimension and an unprecedented, 
broad range of features and applications.
The product itself is no longer enough for today’s consumers, who value experience 
over all else. From providing commodities to services to experience, the Experience 
Economy  is today a reality, and we have had to adapt and provide the right business 
platform for this very purpose.4

Throughout our story, we have been the catalyst and enabler for industrial

Experience  of Humans ). Our growth reflects the recognition by our customers of the 
value we deliver, which is unequalled.
We have expanded our scope of activity from the simulation of products to the 
simulation of nature and life. This calls for new areas of expertise, including biology, 
geology, materials science, and more. Consequently, Dassault Systèmes is pursuing a 
strategy of acquiring firms that offer extensive expertise in these fields. Since 1981, 
we have completed about 70 acquisitions, including more than 20 in the past 5 years. 
Two of the most significant acquisitions are Medidata and Outscale, both of which are 
now Dassault Systèmes brands. We acquired Medidata for their deep clinical expertise 
and pioneering cloud-based solutions, positioning us to lead the digital transformation 
of life sciences and accelerate the era of personalized healthcare and patient-centric 
experience. Adding Outscale provides our customers (including governments and

The 3DEXPERIENCE  platform!
What we sell is a business and innovation platform called the 3DEXPERIENCE  platform, 
calling on Dassault Systèmes brands and addressing the needs of the 12 industries we 
serve.
Our cloud-based platform provides all organizations with a holistic real-time vision 
of their own business activity and ecosystem, connecting people, ideas, data and 
solutions in a single collaborative and interactive environment.
Via the 3DEXPERIENCE  platform, we provide “Industry Solution Experiences” tailored 
for each industry. The platform also acts as a marketplace, or trading platform, that 
connects service providers (3D printing, design etc.) and buyers.
Symbolized by the Compass, the 3D EXPERIENCE  platform is the only platform that’s 
both a system of operations to run a business and a business model to transform a 
business.
As part of the Industry Renaissance, our 3DEXPERIENCE  platform provides an 
environment that empowers users to innovate in an entirely new way. We have 
entered the age of the platform-based economy. Value lies in connecting people, 
ideas, data and solutions.
 As a system of operations, the 3DEXPERIENCE  platform enables businesses to reach 
operational excellence. It allows everyone involved in an innovation project – from the
research lab to the factory to the consumer – to interact and work together. As a result, 
it empowers innovators to design and test consumer experiences, from the idea to
market delivery and usage, before actually producing them.
 As a business model, the 3DEXPERIENCE  platform allows businesses to become 
“platform companies” that transform the relationships and roles across their business
network, mostly by removing intermediaries between sellers and buyers, purchasers 
and subcontractors, service providers and end-customers. This is why our platform
also acts as a marketplace, or trading platform, that connects customers willing to buy 
services (3D printing, design etc.) and service providers.
The 3DEXPERIENCE  platform connects all Dassault Systèmes applications as well as 
those deployed by our customers.WHAT IS THE 
3DEXPERIENCE  PLATFORM ?8

It’s the Amazon of Manufacturing!
The cloud-based marketplace is a new trading platform for digital design, engineering 
and manufacturing transactions, with the ambition to transform the industrial world in 
the same way Amazon has transformed legacy retail.
The 3DEXPERIENCE  Marketplace encompasses the full process from upstream thinking 
to ownership. The first two services are: Make , for on-demand manufacturing, and 
Part Supply , for intelligent part sourcing.
Marketplace comprises two categories of services:
1. COMMUNITY SERVICES
  Available to everyone who needs access to services.
  All users in our installed base have access to our 3DEXPERIENCE  platform on
    the cloud and can buy or sell on the Marketplace.
  What’s our role? As well as selecting partners according to exacting criteria, we  
    also carry out the actual transactions.
2. ENTERPRISE SERVICES
  This service is not open to everyone.
  Companies are given the possibility of having their own private Marketplace,  
    going back and forth from public to private sector in a controlled way.
  What’s our role? We check their credentials to qualify for more advanced  
    dynamic services, and also conduct the transactions.
In what way is this a change in business model for us? Rather than selling solutions to 
create a product, we make the services available and associate ourselves with the final 
result. From the user point of view, you’re not buying the solution; you’re buying the 
outcome of the solution.10WHAT IS THE  
MARKETPLACE ?

3DEXPERIENCE  platform on the cloud to connect their users through a collaborative

They are our industry-focused offerings that deliver specific value to customers and/or 
their end-users. Our customers don’t expect us to provide them with a technology but 
rather to help their organization grow and move forward. Industry Solution Experiences 
are defined by answering the question “WHAT does the Industry value the most?”11

VISION:  We offer a clear vision of the future, which helps customers anticipate their 
own customers’ future requirements and imagine the route their company should take. 
This vision is summarized in our purpose – 3DEXPERIENCE  universes to harmonize 
product, nature and life.

With our field of expertise continually evolving, our competitors change all the time! 
That said, there is no other company offering such an extensive portfolio of solutions.
None of our competitors offer such an extensive portfolio of solutions across the 
entire PLM & 3DEXPERIENCE  markets. Depending on the area, our main competitors 
could be Siemens PLM, Autodesk, SAP, PTC or Ansys.WHO ARE YOUR  
COMPETITORS ?We are, of course!
We are the market leader in PLM (Product Lifecyle Management) and 3DEXPERIENCE .
We launched PLM in 1999 and are still the market leader today, with a 33% market 
share  (ahead of Siemens PLM, which accounts for 21%, and PTC/Autodesk, which has 
respectively 9 and 6 % share).
Our 3DEXPERIENCE  platform was rolled out in 2014 and we’re the only company in 
the Industry with such a positioning. As a unique player in 3DEXPERIENCE , we are pre-
empting this market. With  3DEXPERIENCE , we’ve doubled our market potential from 
$16 billion with PLM to $33 billion.
Taking a closer look:
  In the area of 3D design, Dassault Systèmes is the world’s number one 
    solutions provider with CATIA (complex systems), SOLIDWORKS (products), 
    BIOVIA (life sciences) and GEOVIA (natural resources).
  In the area of collaborative innovation, Dassault Systèmes is the leading global 
    provider with ENOVIA (real-time process and data management) and 3DEXCITE 
    (real-time high-definition visual experiences).
  In the area of simulation, Dassault Systèmes is the world’s number two with    
    SIMULIA.
  In the area of the virtual factory and supplier chain, Dassault Systèmes is the 
    world’s number one with DELMIA Quintiq.17

No. We have a stable and family-based shareholder structure.
Dassault Systèmes is fortunate to have a stable and largely family-based shareholder 
structure, which protects us against the risk of a hostile takeover bid (the Groupe 
Industriel Marcel Dassault holding company owns a 40,11% equity stake). Plus, we 
have a market capitalization of €44.6 bn / $47.8 bn, which limits the chance of any 
attempts to gain control by a competitor. By firmly controlling our future, we can 
secure sustainable value creation for our customers as well as for our shareholders.ARE YOU AT RISK OF 
BEING TAKEN OVER   
BY A COMPETITOR?We see startups as partners rather than competitors. That’s the reason we created 
the 3DEXPERIENCE  Lab, our dedicated startup accelerator.
We see startups as a source of innovative ideas and new, complementary social and 
business models to those deployed by larger organizations. So, from that perspective, 
we view startups as partners rather than competitors.
We support startups that are investing in innovation-driven sectors, such as biology, 
materials and nanotechnology. DAMAE Medical, for example, (skin cancer diagnosis 
through hand-held devices) and XSun (solar drones) are among our partners 
at the 3DEXPERIENCE  Lab, our dedicated startup accelerator. Startups also join 
Dassault Systèmes to gain access to a wider audience for their high-tech solutions (this 
was the case for NETVIBES , Squareclock and Archividéo).19

We have five different ways to sell our solutions. Each approach is based on client 
size and sophistication, who services the customer, geography coverage and whether 
the relationship occurs primarily in-person or online.
 Customer Solutions Experiences (CSE)  is a direct engagement approach led by 
Dassault Systèmes Sales employees, who serve our enterprise clients. These 
customers tend to be undergoing business transformations enabled by digital 
technology. Our value engagement delivery approach focuses on creating 
high value for our clients aligned to their strategic business imperatives. Our 
CSE business also works extensively with our Consulting & Systems Integration 
partners such as Accenture, Capgemini and IBM.
 Customer Process Experiences (CPE)  is an indirect engagement model approach 
for clients who are involved in Industry Value Networks or positioned as Future 
Industry Leaders. These clients are one of our fastest-growing segments and 
are served by our Certified Partners: independent organizations who have 
selected our technologies and signed distribution agreements across designated 
geographies.
 Customer Role Experiences (CRE)  is also an indirect engagement model serviced 
by our Certified Partners and serves primarily those clients previously known 
as our SOLIDWORKS network. CRE is now enabled with the full 3DEXPERIENCE  
platform and Dassault Systèmes brand technologies through 3DEXPERIENCE  
Works, offering our clients new capabilities from design and manufacturing to 
marketing and service in one collaborative product development environment.
 Customer Online Experience (COE)  is an online direct-engagement approach for 
clients that expect end-to-end engagement for cloud-delivered roles. This online 
experience provides a continuous relationship that helps users grow and enable 
their businesses at pace with innovation and efficiency.
 Life Sciences Engagement (LSE)  is a specialized engagement model for the Life 
Sciences & Healthcare industry, serving clients across Pharmaceuticals, Medical 
Device and Diagnostics, small and emerging Biotech, as well as Contract Research 
Organizations. Its mission is to drive end-to-end business value to enable clients 
to deliver smarter treatments for healthier people, from discovery through 
clinical and commercialization stages of a therapy or device. It leverages direct 
and indirect sales channels through LSE resources, sales and services resources 
from the geographies, CRO partners and VARs. LSE embraces the Value Selling 
approach, collaborating for superior value delivery and sustainable & replicable 
client success.21HOW DO YOU SELL  
YOUR SOLUTIONS ?

We are a European company with a global presence and market reach. Our customers 
operate in 140 countries. In 2022, Asia-Oceania accounted for 22% of our revenue, 
the Americas 41% and Europe 36%.Absolutely — and more and more  of our customers are deploying the 3D EXPERIENCE 
platform on cloud.
We continue to focus on getting more customers onto cloud; our cloud software 
revenue grew 22% in 2022, representing 23% of software revenue.
Developing native cloud solutions is a major focus of our R&D efforts to help us 
continue to deliver breakthrough user experiences. The 3DEXPERIENCE  platform is 
built around an online architecture.22

Bernard CHARLÈS is our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (CEO). 
He joined the company in 1983 as an intern, later creating the New Technologies 
department and then took the lead in our Strategy & R&D departments. Since then, 
he has brought the company to its current leading position on the market, positioning 
Dassault Systèmes as the world leader  in virtual universes and as the preferred partner 
for innovation. Bernard firmly believes that virtual technology is about connecting 
imagination and science.
Pascal DALOZ is our Deputy CEO and Chief Operating Officer (COO). 
He joined the company in 2001 as Vice President R&D in charge of sales development 
and has lead our Strategy, Marketing & Brands departments, before becoming head 
of corporate Finance & Strategy. Pascal has the ability to embrace future trends and 
bring together the most original talents. He’s been a key contributor to Dassault 
Systèmes’ pioneering new sectors and is currently orchestrating the transformation 
of all strategic functions.
Bernard, Pascal and the rest of the executive committee are a tangible demonstration 
that great careers can be pursued at Dassault Systèmes. 
In April 2022, planned changes to the governance of Dassault Systèmes were 
announced. In June 2023 it was announced that Pascal Daloz will become Chief 
Executive Officer as of January 1, 2024. Bernard Charlès will continue as Chairman of 
the Board of Directors after that date.
Pascal and Bernard share the same vision for Dassault Systèmes: pushing the 
boundaries of science and the imagination to enable everyone to help build a more 
sustainable world. Pascal will lead us on the next stage of our journey to fulfill this 
purpose.WHO RUNS  
THE COMPANY ? 24

Dassault Systèmes has a global-local-specialized organization: Global – to inspire 
the strategy; Local – to serve customers closely; Specialized – our industry-tailored 
offerings & our brands.
This organization empowers us to leverage our global strengths, while at the same 
time ensuring a strong local proximity with customers and partners and enabling a 
more flexible management structure responsive to local needs at the client, partner 
and employee level, thanks to our 11 geographic management teams.HOW IS 
DASSAULT SYSTÈMES  
ORGANIZED ?25
Dassault Aviation is one of our customers; we are part of the same holding company.
Dassault Systèmes was created by Marcel Dassault and Charles Edelstenne in 1981 as 
a spin-off from Dassault Aviation, a leading French aerospace company. Its purpose 
was to market software that was initially designed by and for Dassault Aviation, with 
the aim of becoming the industry benchmark in computer-aided design.
Dassault Systèmes and Dassault Aviation are separate companies and both are part of 
the same family-owned holding company, Groupe Industriel Marcel Dassault (GIMD). 
And Dassault Aviation is still one of our customers to this day!26WHAT IS YOUR  
RELATIONSHIP  WITH  
DASSAULT AVIATION ?53

Our values are the core conditions to create sustainable innovation.WHAT ARE THE   
COMPANY’S CORE  
VALUES ?
Our values are set to build a questioning mindset: “IF” refers to our passion to explore 
new possibilities and “WE” to our belief that, by connecting people, we can bring about 
meaningful change.27

Not at all, we need all types of expertise to run the company. That said, engineers 
design the solutions we sell and this is our core business.
R&D accounts for 41% of our workforce. Sales, marketing and services is 46%. The 
other 13% works in general administration roles such as finance, human resources, 
legal, etc. 
Most of the engineers we recruit have scientific backgrounds (mathematics, physics, 
biology, etc.,) or specific knowledge about a given industry.
For our sales teams, we look for people with experience in a particular sector of industry, 
since Dassault Systèmes now serves 12 industries, including consumer packaged 
goods & retail, infrastructure, energy & materials, and life sciences & healthcare.
Over and above specific skills, we seek to recruit people with an agile mindset and a 
willingness to embrace challenges.Sustainable innovation.
Our culture is driven primarily by a commitment to innovation and to having a positive 
impact on society. Everything we do is geared to the future. We constantly ask 
ourselves: what will life be like 10 years from now? How will we produce goods? How 
will we travel? This is why many of our customers are pioneers in their field (robotics, 
energy, mobility and more).
  
Bernard Charlès instills a culture of ongoing innovation. He is a firm believer that science 
and technology contribute to social progress. He has positioned Dassault Systèmes as 
the preferred partner for innovation.

Women make up more than 28 % of our workforce.
Dassault Systèmes runs a program called 3DS WIN (3DS Women’s INitiative) aimed 
at attracting more women to the company and supporting them in their career 
management. Women compose 38.5% of governing bodies at Dassault Systèmes 
and represent 27.3% of company executives. To contribute to the development of 
inclusive leadership skills for future managers to support sustainable performance and 
innovation, a 9- month Rise Up! program was introduced.
Not anymore: in 2015 we changed our legal status to European Company (Societas 
Europaea).
Since the outset, Dassault Systèmes has operated as an international organization. As 
a French startup in the early 1980s, our team of 20 people was already working with 
giants in the aerospace and automotive industry, such as Boeing and Honda.
 
Today, we have 22,500 employees from 136 countries; of these, 38% are based 
in Europe, 33% in Asia-Pacific and 29% in the Americas. And we have +300,000 
customers in 170 countries. 38% are based in Europe, 33% in Asia-Pacific and 29% 
in Americas.
In 2015, Dassault Systèmes officially changed its status from French to a European 
company, reflecting its international culture and global positioning.ARE YOU A FRENCH

Yes! As proof, our CEO started as an intern
We offer a lot of exciting career opportunities. Our company has experienced continuous 
growth since its inception in 1981 and we are pursuing ongoing diversification into 
new areas. What’s more, every year we execute what we call the “3O’s” process, which 
is an annual review of our objectives, organization and operations to stay aligned with 
our strategic goals.
And lastly, in addition to the annual meeting to define their objectives for the current 
year, employees have a formal meeting with their manager on a yearly basis to review 
their individual development and career expectations.
Having said that, at Dassault Systèmes we do not map out career plans for people. 
Instead, each individual is encouraged to take an active part in seizing development 
opportunities.Our staff turnover is lower than the market average.
In a context of high demand for high -tech skills, the employee voluntary turnover 
rate is positioned at 10.8%, below the average and median rate identified by market 
research at the end of the first half of 2022 for the technology and life sciences sectors. 
Many of our people have spent a good part of their career at Dassault Systèmes.
